key_channel_insights.line_content: OTA parity reached 83.8% (+1.3 ppt WoW); price gaps are now commercially negligible, signalling improving distribution discipline.
89.5% of fares on metasearch undercut the site by ~4%, exposing systemic revenue dilution, especially in Swiss-origin and advance-purchase traffic.
92.6% of GDS fares are higher than direct, yet the average +0.36% markup limits absolute risk while indicating scope to align early-purchase pricing.

conclusion.line_content: This report provides a high-level summary of the price discrepancies observed across different channels.  It is important to note that the data contains many nuances depending on various factors such as market conditions, booking windows, and the competitive landscape. Understanding these subtleties can be critical in optimizing pricing strategies and ensuring competitive positioning.

As part of our 'PriceEye' solution, we are developing an intuitive dashboard designed to help your airline's analysts drill down into this data. This tool will allow you to uncover and focus on critical actionable insights, enabling your team to make data-driven decisions with confidence.

We are here to support you in leveraging these insights to enhance your revenue management and distribution strategies. Please don't hesitate to connect with our team for more information about how PriceEye can assist you in achieving your business objectives.

ota_highlights.line_content: 83.8% of OTA fares matched the site (+1.3 ppt WoW, +4.2 ppt MoM).
When different, OTAs were only +0.15% higher or –0.03% lower—barely visible to most shoppers.
'Offer not found' fell to 9.2% of checks, reducing the risk of LX being invisible on OTAs.

ota_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: +1.26 ppt WoW; channel nearing full alignment with direct fares.
Down 0.15 ppt WoW, showing modest progress in content completeness.
Average discount just 0.03%, limiting revenue impact but worth monitoring.

ota_summary_by_region.line_content: Parity 83.4%; undercuts 4.8%; premiums 2.3%—closely tracking network average.
100% parity achieved; previous 2.1% premium incidents eliminated.

ota_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: Highest parity at 88.9%; discounts negligible (0.1%); premiums 2.1%.
Parity drops to 78.7%; OTA discounts jump to 9.2%, concentrating risk outside home market.

ota_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Parity 81.1%; OTA undercuts 6.1%—last-minute shoppers remain price-sensitive.

mse_highlights.line_content: 89.5% of fares cheaper on MSE, averaging a 4% markdown.
Price-matched cases down to 3.1% (–0.8 ppt MoM).
>90% MSE-lower in Swiss-origin and far-out bookings, risking early-purchase revenue.

mse_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Undercut frequency worsened 1.4 ppt MoM; average discount 4%.
True parity now the exception, limiting brand consistency.
Stable vs last month, indicating persistent distribution gaps.

mse_summary_by_region.line_content: 89.4% of itineraries priced lower, eroding intra-Europe yields.

mse_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: Undercut 88.7%; rare higher fares (0.1%) offer minimal offset.

mse_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: 88.6% lower, deteriorating 1.7 ppt MoM—high-value segment at risk.
91.3% lower; early-booking leakage persists (+0.7 ppt MoM).

gds_highlights.line_content: 92.6% of GDS prices above direct, reinforcing a consistent premium.
Average uplift +0.36%, limiting absolute revenue loss but impacting price perception.
Largest premium (+0.49%) on advance purchases with zero parity cases.

gds_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: No identical prices recorded for the second week running.

gds_summary_by_region.line_content: 92.3% higher fares; +0.37% markup; 7.7% web fare missing.

gds_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: 92.8% higher; channel’s steepest +0.49% premium despite slight frequency drop.
